any of small arthropod animals belonging to the class of Insecta, characterised, in the adult state, by division of the body into head, thorax, and abdomen, three pairs of legs on the thorax, and, usu., two pairs of membranous wings, including beetles, bees, flies, wasps, and mosquitoes; an insect.
a man who annoys, disturbs or persecutes esp. with hostile intent or injurious effect; a molester.

the quality or tendency of inflicting pain, annoyance to another or others.
the act or practice of persecution, molestation.
a kind of delirium characterised by confusion, hallucination etc.
any substance used to kill insects; an insecticide.
that which feed principally on insects; an insectivore.

the act of annoying, irritating or pestering others, in a petty way; the act of playing mischief; mischief-making; an instance of this.

a person having special knowledge of entomology; an entomologist.

an insect - a) any of numerous small invertebrate animals, chiefly the ones that carry or cause various diseases.
feeding on insects; (of a plant) able to capture and digest insects (as the sundew, the Venus fly-trap, etc.); insectivorous.

an insectivore - a) any of gen. small, primitive mammals of Insectivora order, that are active mainly at night and that feed principally on insects, as moles, shrews or hedgehogs; b) any animal or plant that feeds on insects.
the feeling or attitude of one who looks down on somebody or something as being low, mean or unworthy; scorn; contempt.

blood - a) the fluid that circulates in the body of a vertebrate animal carrying nourishment and oxygen to and bringing away waste products from all parts of the body; b) a comparable fluid of an invertebrate.
the liquid that is abundantly available on the earth, got from clouds as rain, forms streams, lakes, and seas, and is a major constituent of all living matter; water.
a very sweet, pleasant drink, often likened to ambrosia of the gods.
a sweet viscid material elaborated out of the nectar of flowers in the honey sac of various bees; honey.
the colour of the blood; the red colour.
the prolonged cry made by a horse; neigh.
the soft parts of the body of a vertebrate, esp. the parts composed chiefly of skeletal muscle as distinguished from visceral structures, bone, and integuments; flesh.
that which is water-born; a lotus plant.
its flower.
fire, the most common form of energy, a phenomenon of combustion manifested in light, flame and heat.

the moon, as the enemy of lotus flowers.

a god, whose food is ambrosia.

a mechanical device for fastening things together, consisting essentially of a cylindrical or conical piece of metal threaded evenly around its outside surface with an advancing spiral ridge and commonly having a slotted head, which can be driven into by being turned; a screw.

any feeling of inferiority, inadequacy, etc. esp. a neurotic condition resulting from various feelings of inferiority, such as derive from real or imagined physical or social inadequacy and often manifested through overcompensation in excessive aggressiveness, a domineering attitude, etc.; inferiority complex.
